zone.line: Faust
Alas! I cannot endure thee!
Spirit
Thou didst implore earnestly me to see,
My voice to hear, my countenance to behold
Me bent thy mighty soul-prayer,
Here am I!— What pitiful terror
Seizes superhuman you. Wher is of thy Soul the
fame?
Where is the breast? which a world in itself contains
And and posesses, which with joy trembling
Swelled, as us, the Spirits like to rise
What art thou Faust? That voice to me resounds
Which itself to me with all its powers urged.
Art thou he? Whyo by my breath round-thundered
In all thy lifes-depth shook
A cowardly crooked worm!
Faust
Shall I thee Image of ?Fire, propitiate?
I am, I am Faust, I am thy likeness
